project.title: Mountain City - Web Video Series (@164cray network)
project.author: Scott Grocott x- @scott_grocott
project.description: Mountain City is on the island of Autopia. Autopia is a socially stratified island nation where car culture dominates daily life. The city is known for its towering skyscrapers, sprawling highways, and dense urban environment filled with neon lights and bustling streets. The story follows a lone protagonist navigating the dangerous underbelly of Mountain City, uncovering conspiracies tied to the powerful automotive families that control the city's economy and politics.
production_design: Miniature live sets with practical effects
Audio/Script production approach. Modeled after radio drama and 'South Park'.
It's all about the cars: custom builds, stunts, chases. Anytime we can focus on vehicles, we do. Car action first and narrative second.
car culture as worldbuilding: the social dynamics, fashion, music, and architecture are all influenced by automotive themes.
series_arc: The whole series will be in 3 acts.

Act 1 introduces the world and characters.Most of the primary action will take place in the wooded outskirts of the city,with occasional cutaways to the city for establishing various elements. The primary location is the 'A.O.K. Kampground' this camping facility is a more affordable, open to everyone (meaning all makes and models of cars). The campground,is ajacent to a giant recreational area for auto enthusiasts. Campers bring their vehicle to enjoy all kinds of auto performance activity.

Act 2 Takes our main character from the outskirts into the heart of Mountain City. Here, the protagonist uncovers deeper conspiracies involving the powerful automotive families that control the city. High-speed chases through neon-lit streets, daring escapes, and intense confrontations define this act.This culminates in a showdown with leader of the Ferrari family, revealing their plans to monopolize the city's automotive industry.

Act 3 Adds the final twist in that the city is taken over by a new more powerful boss.'Chad Boss' to be exact. Chad moves in with his Lamborghini operation (up until this point in the series Lamborghini has not be seen or spoken of because Chad had not been called in yet) and begins to battle the powers that be to get the city under his control in a high-stakes showdown that reshapes Mountain City.

protagonist.name: Edward Van Heflen

car.base: rusty, Mater-inspired original character pieced together from junkyard scraps
car.condition: barely runs, backfires constantly, laughed at by everyone
car.emotional_value: the only thing he truly owns; every mod is a promise to himself and his missing brother

jobs: Cashier at the kampground general store
protagonist.living_situation: Permanently parked, beat-to-hell travel trailer behind the store

family_backstory.father: Low-tier commuter-class driver, died in a suspicious high-speed crash when Eddie was 9 – officially ruled 'driver error', but Eddie never believed it
family_backstory.mother: Worked double shifts at a Tortellini-owned parts warehouse until her health broke; now lives off-island

older_brother.name: Alex Van Heflen
older_brother.last_seen: Three years ago, after bragging he’d been offered a secret test drive for one of the big families
older_brother.clues_left_behind: A half-finished turbo blueprint and an old leather toolkit Eddie still keeps under his bed

protagonist.core_desire: To be handed the keys to a real dynasty race car just once – not for fame, but to prove to himself (and to whatever’s left of Lucas) that he’s fast enough

emotional_core.primary_wound: Feels he’s the reason Lucas vanished – thinks his brother took a dangerous gig to get Eddie a shot that never came
emotional_core.daily_pain: Sweeping cigarette butts off the same tracks where legends are made their name, selling energy drinks to the kids who already have what he wants
emotional_core.hidden_fear: That he isn’t actually fast – that all the daydreams are just delusion and Lucas died for nothing

protagonist.current_state: Quiet, watchful, polite to a fault. Speaks softly, listens hard, and can strip an alternator in four minutes flat. Zero confidence behind the wheel of anything faster than a golf cart, but his hands don’t shake when he’s holding a wrench.

primary_location.name: A.O.K. Kampground
primary_location.position: on the outermost edge of the massive Autopia National Motor Recreation Area
primary_location.description: A sprawling, no-frills campground for gearheads who can't afford the resorts. Dusty lots, fire rings made from old wheels, communal tool sheds, and a single general store. It's the only place on the entire rec area where unlicensed commuters and independents are allowed to stay overnight.
primary_location.relationship_to_rec_area: sits just outside the gated perimeter of the Autopia National Motor Recreation Area (a national-park-sized complex of tracks, resorts, and proving grounds). Wealthy dynasties and tourists use the luxury resorts adjacent to the park; A.O.K. is where the working stiffs park their trailers and watch the skyline of neon tracks glow at night.
daily_sights: dynasty racing teams hauling Hot Wheels Ferrari fleets through the gates
rich tourists in Mini GT and premium replicas checking into five-star auto-resorts
Canyon Crossing off-roaders roaring past on their way to the trails
Mountain City street racers sneaking in for late-night practice sessions
primary_location.protagonist_perspective: every shift he sees the life he wants on the other side of the fence—while he's stuck mowing the grass and selling energy drinks to the people living it

protagonist_friend_group.vibe: Stranger Things tech misfits meet Goonies-style gearhead rebels

members.name: Rusty
members.backstory: Prodigy tinkerer from Bay City. His family’s Peugeot garage was fire-bombed by Tortellini enforcers over unpaid 'protection.' He escaped with only a duffel of tools and a lifelong hatred of the dynasties. Now he turns scrap into weapons, traps, and impossible mods while quietly tracking every family shipment that rolls past the kampground.
members.how_they_met: Met the protagonist during a late-night meltdown of the protagonist’s barely-running Frankenstein car. Rusty watched him stubbornly try to repair it alone, saw the same desperation he grew up with, and stepped in. The 'fix' was dangerous, brilliant, and held together with three bolts and hope—marking the start of their partnership.
traits: Combines scrap tech with car parts
Dark, sarcastic comic relief with sudden strokes of genius
members.interaction_with_protagonist: Constantly upgrades the protagonist’s Frankenstein car, pushing wild ideas that either win races or nearly kill them—usually both.

members.name: Echo
members.backstory: Former mainland corporate data analyst who discovered the dynasties were rigging fuel prices island-wide. When she tried to leak it, they put a bounty on her. She fled to the kampground, rewired the old CB tower into a surveillance net, and now watches everything without ever being seen.
members.how_they_met: The protagonist discovered Echo long before he actually met her—through anonymous warnings scribbled on receipts, marked maps tucked under his trailer door, and mysterious static bursts on the CB radio. Eventually he caught her calibrating a homemade antenna behind the general store. She said only one sentence: 'You're standing in a blind spot,' and from then on she quietly watched over him.
traits: Master of scavenged surveillance and hacked police scanners
Sees patterns no one else notices
members.interaction_with_protagonist: Feeds the protagonist cryptic warnings and shortcuts, speaking in half-sentences that somehow always save his skin.

members.name: Nova
members.backstory: Grew up in the Port Injection slums running bets for the Kim family’s underground fight club. Kicked out (and nearly killed) for refusing to throw a match. He’s been plotting revenge ever since, turning every race into a chess move against the dynasties.
members.how_they_met: Nova first noticed the protagonist during an impromptu illegal time-trial near the edge of Mountain City. The protagonist wasn’t racing—he was quietly watching from behind a fence. Nova clocked his hunger instantly. Later that night, after a small scuffle with some dynasty punks, Nova saw the protagonist stand his ground despite being scared out of his mind. Nova decided he’d found a wildcard worth backing.
traits: Natural leader who drags everyone into glorious trouble
members.interaction_with_protagonist: Sees the protagonist as the perfect wildcard and constantly maneuvers him into bigger, riskier plays against the families.

members.name: Axel
members.backstory: Former off-road champion blacklisted by the Boss family after he refused to fix a Velocity Flats record run. They slashed his tires and left him in the desert. He walked out three days later towing his wrecked truck with a winch he built from junk. Now he maps every hidden trail on Autopia and lives for the next impossible stunt.
members.how_they_met: Axel met the protagonist when he caught him trying—and failing spectacularly—to navigate a forbidden back trail on a junky scooter. Instead of laughing, Axel admired the guts it took. He tossed the kid the keys to his beat-up runner truck and said, 'If you’re gonna crash something, crash something worth the story.' It was the protagonist’s first time driving a real machine.
members.interaction_with_protagonist: The first person to ever let the protagonist drive a real race car; pushes him harder than anyone, believing the kid’s got champion blood.

members.name: Maggie
members.backstory: Daughter of a legendary independent fabricator who died when a faulty engine she helped design exploded during a test. The dynasties covered it up and blamed her family. She carries the guilt, but also every blueprint her father ever drew, and she’s determined to build something that will make the families remember her name.
members.how_they_met: They met when the protagonist found Maggie rummaging through the scrappers’ pile behind the kampground workshop, hunting for a very specific bolt pattern from a discontinued engine. They bonded instantly over mutual underdog dreams and shared grief—hers for her father, his for a life he’s never been allowed to touch. She became the first to tell him he wasn’t dreaming too big.
members.interaction_with_protagonist: The emotional anchor; constantly reminds him his dream is worth chasing and quietly sketches mods for the day he finally gets his shot.

protagonist_friend_group.group_dynamic: Five kampground outcasts who turned a dusty trailer park into a rebel workshop and war room. They fight with brains, scrap, and pure nerve, rallying around the protagonist’s quiet dream of one day driving for real—knowing that if he ever gets the keys, they all rise together.

characters.protagonist_friend_group: primary antagonist: Joey Tortellini (Ferrari Family Leader)

autopia.description: A large island nation in the middle of the ocean. Autopia is a socially stratified and car culture dominates daily life. A port city, an inland desert, a mountain filled northern region (The location of Mountain City), a large deep canyon region in the desert. Very mysterious

season_1_outline.title: The Forest Tracks
season_1_outline.season_arc: Eddie Van Heflen goes from unknown A.O.K. groundskeeper to hot prospect courted by multiple dynasties while hunting the truth about his missing brother Alex. Ends with the crew committing to infiltrate Mountain City and confront Joey Tortellini.
season_1_outline.cliffhanger: Anonymous call from J.T. (Joey Tortellini) lures Eddie to Mountain City: 'Your brother asked too many questions.'

key_families.name: Tortellini Ferrari
key_families.approach: shadow puppet-master, never directly offers until finale

mini_arcs.title: Welcome to A.O.K.
mini_arcs.theme: World building, crew assembly, dream defined

episodes.title: First Shift
episodes.logline: On his first day back after winter break, Eddie works his double shift while watching family teams practice—dreaming of a life he’s never allowed to touch.

episodes.title: The Crew
episodes.logline: Eddie’s Frankenstein car breaks down; Rusty fixes it and introduces him to the ragtag crew of dynasty-burned outcasts.

episodes.title: Unlicensed
episodes.logline: Eddie watches Schneider BMW enforcers humiliate a working-class driver, confronting the brutal class system.

episodes.title: Velocity Flats Run
episodes.logline: Axel takes Eddie shotgun on an illegal midnight race—proving raw talent can beat money.

episodes.title: The Families
episodes.logline: A convoy of all 22 families rolls through A.O.K.; Eddie learns the full scope of their power.

episodes.title: Late Night at the Store
episodes.logline: Eddie opens up to Maggie about missing brother Alex and his fear he’ll never be fast enough.

mini_arcs.title: Clues in the Dust
mini_arcs.theme: Alex mystery surfaces, Eddie proves he can drive

episodes.title: The Blueprint
episodes.logline: Hidden turbo schematic in Alex’s old tools reveals first clue: 'Test run—Sector 7'.

episodes.title: Sector 7
episodes.logline: Eddie and Rusty break into abandoned Sector 7; discover covered-up crashes and barely escape security.

episodes.title: Nova’s Plan
episodes.logline: Nova enters Eddie in an underground race to build rep and gather intel.

episodes.title: First Race
episodes.logline: Eddie’s Frankenstein nearly explodes but he guts out a podium against independents.

episodes.title: Word Spreads
episodes.logline: Three families (Nakamura, Johnson, Kim) send scouts hunting 'the kid with the rust bucket'.

episodes.title: Three Offers
episodes.logline: Eddie receives formal recruitment pitches; Echo warns every contract is a cage.

episodes.title: Echo’s Network
episodes.logline: Echo’s intercepts reveal multiple families run secret 'test driver incidents'—Alex’s name appears in three.

episodes.title: The Warehouse
episodes.logline: Eddie and Maggie find redacted logs listing Alex as a contract tester.

episodes.title: Sal
episodes.logline: Paranoid ex-mechanic Sal reveals the families bury failed test drivers in paperwork, not hospitals.

episodes.title: Pressure
episodes.logline: Recruiting families turn hostile—threats, permit revocations, intimidation.

episodes.title: Maggie’s Gambit
episodes.logline: Crew builds a real race car from scrap to prove independence.

episodes.title: The Proving Run
episodes.logline: Eddie smashes the independent lap record at Echo Gorge—attracting Tortellini attention.

episodes.title: Summit Invitation
episodes.logline: Eddie is invited to the exclusive multi-family showcase at Summit Resorts.

episodes.title: Preparations
episodes.logline: Crew turns A.O.K. into a war room—tech, defenses, strategy.

episodes.title: The Showcase
episodes.logline: Brutal multi-heat race where prospects wreck each other for contracts.

episodes.title: Crash
episodes.logline: Johnson Ford driver intentionally wrecks Eddie—reveals hidden Tortellini body cam.

episodes.title: Questions
episodes.logline: Crew realizes Tortellini is secretly funding and manipulating other families’ test programs.

episodes.title: The Call (Season Finale)
episodes.logline: J.T. calls: 'Your brother asked too many questions. Come to Mountain City.' Eddie and crew decide to go in.

season_summary_by_blocks.1-6: World building, crew assembly, dreams defined
season_summary_by_blocks.7-12: Alex mystery surfaces, Eddie proves himself, families recruit
season_summary_by_blocks.19-24: Summit betrayal, Tortellini revealed, crew heads to Mountain City
